I just had the idea of another approach to say what I try to say:

When you=
 implement a client for making requests to serch engines  
described by Ope=
nSearchDescription documents (http:// 
www.opensearch.org) and want your cl=
ient to do something with the  
result (e.g. extract the titles of each hit=
) what media types do you  
expect (at client implementation time) the sear=
ch result to possibly  
be in?


Jan








On Dec 21, 2009, at 1:07 PM, J=
orn Wildt wrote:

>> Hmm, no. You build clients based on the definition of =
the kind of
>> service. With SOAP that would be WSDL and with e.g. AtomPub =
it is the
>> RFC 5023. Building clients for individual services makes no se=
nse.
>
> Well, then you build clients based on media type descriptions? Tha=
t  
> would be just as meaningfull as building something on top of RFC  
> =
5023. AtomPub/MediaType - what's the difference?
